name: places/ChIJxVQnAL5YwokRWwd3K8qsBfA
formattedAddress: 925 Park Ave #1B, New York, NY 10028, USA
adrFormatAddress: 925 Park Ave #1B, New York, NY 10028, USA

originalText.text: Dr Grossman has been taking care of me for almost 20 years. He has been with me through it all... the good and the bad... my infertility, 2 very complicated high risk pregnancies, and the debilitating postpartum depression that came after both pregnancies. Dr Grossman has always been there for me, always responding to questions and concerns and answering my emails right away, especially in emergencies. He is highly qualified, and he is definitely one of the top doctors in the field, not just in NYC, but in the country or world-wide. I have traveled the world and no other doctor can compare to his level of kindness and expertise.  He knows his stuff and is always up on the latest treatments including meds and supplements. I wouldn’t trust anyone else. He kept me stable for many years, and always pulled me out of the pit of hell.  Even when I couldn’t see a light at the end of the tunnel, I knew I had Dr Grossman. My only fear is that one day he will retire and I won’t have him anymore! Thank you Dr Grossman for being a great doctor.

originalText.text:
Please stay away from Dr. Grossman. I came to him when I needed mental health support during a physical health emergency. He coldly gaslighted me by claiming I was not physically ill. He is not a neurologist and had no authority to try to convince me I was not unwell physically. I was later confirmed to be severely ill by an expert neurologist.

Dr. Grossman's reply beneath my review is factually incorrect. I was never referred to him by a physician, I found his practice through a family friend. He did state I did not have a physical illness at the time.

He is not a neurologist and had no authority to try to convince me I was not unwell physically. I was later confirmed to be severely ill by an expert neurologist.

Dr. Grossman's reply beneath my review is factually incorrect. I was never referred to him by a physician, I found his practice through a family friend. He did state I did not have a physical illness at the time.

originalText.text: I  am a psychotherapist and I am routinely referring my clients to Dr. Grossman for medical management. I have referred to him people with OCD, ASD, anxiety, depression, bipolar disorders.  All my clients have been extremely happy with Dr. Grossman. he is very thorough. He reads emails. He takes detailed notes. I know because during our phone consultations Dr Grossman was able to provide me very detailed  information about each and every one of my clients.  When you are reading some of the negative reviews below, please remember that people are far more likely to leave a negative review than a positive one because when people finally feel better, they just want to forget the entire negative experience.  I understand that people who have negative experience with Dr.Grossman make valid points and have valid concerns. It's their experience and they are right to share it.  However, please remember that there are probably hundreds and hundreds of people, who had wonderful experience with Dr.Grossman and simply did not leave a review (because when everything is great, no reason to let the world know about your history of mental illness).  Wishing everybody great health (mental and physical). and many thanks to Dr.Grossman for his expertise and dedication.

originalText.text: Dr. Grossman is amazing, I've been seeing him for about 4 years. He always listens to what I'm going through and very clearly tells me his thoughts. I was on a bunch of medications for a long time (recommended by him and others), and after a few years was feeling a lot better and we both agreed to lower my dosages down gradually so I could come off the meds. He was very responsive to my needs and concerns, and we worked together to make sure everything was addressed. He is super responsive via email and always answers my questions. I'd highly recommend seeing him as your psychiatrist.
